From: Jared Isaacman
Sent: Wednesday, March 18, 2015 4:36:35 PM
To: JR Rzad
Subject: RE: Harbortouch Deal Legal Review

Okay sounds good.

We are not going to steal their merchants. I understand that you do not want to address the subject and that’s
between you and I. . .

From: JR Rzad
Sent: Wednesday, March 18, 2015 4:25 PM
To: Jared Isaacman
Subject: Harbortouch Deal Legal Review

I am going to finalize this with Howard so we, at least, can have the agreements done. While
I like your concession on pricing to make volume tiers based on new business and,
ultimately, it's a good approach, I am not comfortable with addressing a conversion. They
don't know we would do it anyway with or without the right to do so. I do not feel like
poking the bear on this topic. I have a call into outside M&A counsel to discuss the
approach.

The non-solicit is also important because they have good sales people, developers, ISV
relationships, etc. that we do not want them having access to while they have the keys to
all of our merchants.

Date: November 27, 2017 at 1:58:40 PM EST
To: "Shift4 Sales (sales@shift4.com)" <sales id="keSvIQTf3d" data-rand="r1W8OPnW2s"@shift4.com>
Cc: "Samantha এক্ষেত্রে [ডাটা] <[ডাটা]
Subject: PCI Program Management

Team,

As we continue to review the recent changes to the PCI program, we have discovered an issue that
will impact a select group of merchants The details are outlined below.

•	As of November 1st, Shift4 began billing $9.95/month for the Statement Fee.
•	 The previous Statement Fee was $5.05.
•	 The sales team mentioned that there were some accounts that should have remained at the $5.05
    rate and were not to be increased to $9,95,

Action – We are working to identify those merchants that should not have been increased to the S9.95 fee
and will ensure their accounts are credited appropriately.

Once we have completed the final review, we will follow up with further instructions, There is no need to
contact Customer Support at this time,

Thank you,

Kyle K প্রেসিডেন্ট

Shift4 Corporation
[ডাটা]
[ডাটা]
[ডাটা]

We have an verbal agreement with the following terms...
• We will assume that the average account is processing $35k/mo.
• We will agree to pay 4x on the first 2000 accounts only.
• We will pay full price for any account that exceeds S50k/mo in volume.
• We will not put a cap on total volume.
• They want to sell the accounts in large groups and agree to 4x on all or nothing. They asked for
 10x, then 8x, 6x and held at 4x as their line in the sand.

Jared,

Thank you and your counsel for the clarification call yesterday. It is good to hear that we are aligned related
to our Card Connect relationship, As I mentioned to you yesterday, our contract has dear and specific
language related to the ownership, and more importantly the servicing responsibilities (boarding, risk, loss
prevention, funding, statements, etc.), of the merchants once acquired, The language is iron clad that First
Data retains all responsibilities, rights, and decisions related to the merchants,

Assuming you are successful in acquiring specific HT merchants from CDC, we expect to receive a formal
notification from Card Connect for termination of the processing as outlined in our agreement, Once the
notification is received, we have specific and contractual obligations as it relates to merchant attrition,
including a formal right of first refusal (ROFR) on any merchants you seek to move to any other processor.
We would expect and anticipate CDC to fully support their contractual obligation in this matter,

Again, we appreciate our partnership with Shift4, We have great respect for what you and the team have
accomplished over the years, and we have no interest in impeding your inorganic growth strategy. We do,
however have a contractual and fiduciary obligation to protect out rights, shareholders. and customers, Please
let me know if | can provide any additional clarification.
Thanks.
/AS

From:		Jared Isaacman
Sent:		3/18/2015 4:36:35 PM
To:		JR Rzad
Subject:		RE: Harbortouch Deal Legal Review

Okay sounds good.

We are not goint to steal their merchants.  I understand that you do not want to address the subject and that's
between you and I...

From: JR Rzad
Sent: Wednesday, March 18, 2015 4:25 PM
To: Jared Isaacman
Subject: Harbortouch Deal Legal Review

I am going to finalize this with Howard so we, at least, can have the agreements done.  While
I like your concession on pricing to make volume tiers based on new business and,
ultimately, it's a good approach, I am not comfortable with addressing a conversion.  They
don't know we would do it anyway with or without the right to do so.  I do not feel like
poking the bear on this topic.  I have a call into outside M&A counsel to discuss the
approach.

The non-solicit is also important because they have good sales people, developers, ISV
relationships, etc, that we do not want them having access to while they have the keys to
all of our merchants.
